result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin A. Alloway

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 2:36 PM/ RM 301, 22CF180, 22CF196 & 20CF182.  Defendant Kevin A. Alloway appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has Atty Koppelman in 20CF182, Atty Koppelman has not filed a notice of retainer in 22CF180 or 22CF196. Court questions if Def. has had communication with Atty. Koppelman, Def. confirms and notes Atty Koppelman is tied up in court today, but does plan to represent Def. in all three cases. State notes 20CF182 should be set for Status Conference and 22CF196 and 22CF180 should be set for an Adjourned Initial Appearance. Def. questions conditions of bond. State objects to hearing bond conditions today as needs to be seen by Judge Rhode. Court advises Def. to speak to Atty. Koppelman regarding bond modification. Def. makes remarks, Court responds.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with victim. 
No contact with Barb Alloway. 
Def. to comply with conditions previously ordered on 22CF180.
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

Court calls @ 3:05 PM/ RM 301, 22CF180 & 22CF196. Defendant Kevin A. Alloway appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history's. Court questions if Def. has heard from attorney on 22CF180. Def. confirms. Court does not have notice of retainer just yet. On 22CF196, Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. does wish to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State is in compliance with victims rights. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $30,000.00 cash bond with conditions of No contact with victim, No contact with Barb Alloway and Def. to comply with conditions previously ordered on 22CF180. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court reviews criminal complaint. Court questions State, State replies. Court considers factors and orders a $50,000.00 cash bond with conditions of No contact with victim, No contact with Barb Alloway, Def. to comply with conditions previously ordered on 22CF180 and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits on P.H. Def. would like to waive time limits on P.H. and wait for counsel. Court accepts waiver of time limits for P.H. and finds good cause. Def. makes remarks and requests Court to allow Def. to speak to Barb Alloway via phone. State objects. Court orders Def. to No contact with Barb Alloway.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
